subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question for you all
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00A8_01CA4BED.D5C8F610
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

None of this is proof. None of this evidence say that all, or even most EVP=
's are caused by PK. You even used words like "potential link" and "strongl=
y implicates."  This doesn't mean it is proven.

--------------------------=
------------------------------------------------------


[Now let's turn to=
 the evidence for PK as an explanation for the EVP. A close colleague of mi=
ne, a respected parapsychologist in Los Angeles, was working years ago in a=
 well-known haunted site in the Hollywood area. He recorded the voice of th=
e home's owner, while standing next to the man. During this interval the ma=
n did not speak; no one heard what was recorded until it was played back. T=
his sounds like a classic EVP thus far. The playback was easily heard by al=
l. The man recognized his own voice, including swear words; he had a pencha=
nt for swearing in his normal speech.]

Not personally having seen or heard=
 of  any documentation of this experiment, I am skeptical of it. But lets j=
ust say it is true and this really happened and as portrayed. This still do=
esn't prove in any way that most EVP's are caused by PK. Again, as I said e=
arlier, I am open to the possibility that it might happened in some rare ca=
ses.

---------------------------------------------------------------------=
-----------


[This anecdotal story would suggest that PK could be an expla=
nation for EVPs based on this single example alone.]

It only suggests that=
 PK *could* have played part on this particular case. To say that PK is res=
ponsible for most EVP-there has to be way more experimentation and testing =
that renders consistent results.

-----------------------------------------=
---------------------------------------


[Lastly we'll consider a recent e=
xperiment by Dr. Dean Radin. In this experiment, ...

This implies that ret=
rocausation could be at work during EVP production. And that suggests the i=
nvolvement of the operator as opposed to discarante entities manipulating t=
he environment.]

I have heard of this experiment. Still, it does not prove=
 that most EVP's are due to PK. All it *suggests* is that PK itself may be =
possible.

----------------------------------------------------------------=
----------------


IMO, if it were the case that most EVP's were caused by =
PK, we should have been able to prove that by now.


  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: phenom_investigator 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sen=
t: Tuesday, October 13, 2009 9:22 AM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question for =
you all


    Let's examine the supporting evidence a bit more closely. Fir=
st consider the potential link between healing and PK. Both phenomena can o=
ccur due to a local or distant agent. Absent healing for example would be t=
he distant analogy to distank or remote PK. Both have been studied in contr=
olled experiments. Dr Larry Dossy in Texas is one of the primary investigat=
ors in healing research. Both healing and general PK are reliably observed =
to be either intentional or spontaneous. So both exhibit similar traits. Bo=
th involve apparent manipulation by the mind of the physical environment. A=
nd certainly healing strongly implicates an indirect effect on complex syst=
ems. So it makes some sense that the two may indeed be related.

  Now let'=
s turn to the evidence for PK as an explanation for the EVP. A close collea=
gue of mine, a respected parapsychologist in Los Angeles, was working years=
 ago in a well-known haunted site in the Hollywood area. He recorded the vo=
ice of the home's owner, while standing next to the man. During this interv=
al the man did not speak; no one heard what was recorded until it was playe=
d back. This sounds like a classic EVP thus far. The playback was easily he=
ard by all. The man recognized his own voice, including swear words; he had=
 a penchant for swearing in his normal speech. This anecdotal story would s=
uggest that PK could be an explanation for EVPs based on this single exampl=
e alone. 

  Lastly we'll consider a recent experiment by Dr. Dean Radin. I=
n this experiment, mediators were asked to influence which paths photons wo=
uld take passing through one of two very tiny slits. You would expect this =
to occur normally by random chance, producing an equal distribution of phot=
ons in two regions on the target photograph. When uninfluenced, this is exa=
ctly what happened. When the mediator tried to 'block' one of the slits, th=
e distribution shifted, indicating success. But this is not what's importan=
t - it is necessary background. For the next trial, the machine was turned =
on and the exposure taken with no influence attempted. In fact, the mediata=
tor was not even present. The following day the mediatator was asked to inf=
luence the machine. He was not told the machine was turned off and could no=
t even record at that time. The next day the image was inspected for the fi=
rst time - the meditator again was not present. The image revealed a patter=
n similar to the one produced when the mediatator successfully "blocked" th=
e slit in the first trial. Theoretical physicst Dr. Richard Stroup suggeste=
d this indicated to him a demonstration of what he calls "retrocausation" -=
 a notion in theoretical physics that the future actually impacts on the pa=
st (as well as the past impacting the future as most people believe). Dr. R=
adin raised an interesting point with respect to designing experiments. He =
now wonders if investigators are so entangled with experiments that they un=
wittingly can influence outcomes even before the experiment is designed. Re=
member, these are trained academicians at the top of their respective field=
s. 

  This implies that retrocausation could be at work during EVP product=
ion. And that suggests the involvement of the operator as opposed to discar=
ante entities manipulating the environment.

  I have no problem with the n=
otion that external influences may indeed in some way mediate what is done;=
 I simply wonder if they are really manipulating sound directly.

  This is=
 what I could consider the evidence for the position I stated.

  --- In EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > Perso=
nal experience, and lack of supporting evidence is why I disagree about PK =
being responsible for most EVPs.
  > 
  > I am open to the possibility that=
 it might be possible, however it would have to be a very rare occurrence.
=
  > 
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: phenom_investigator 
=
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Sunday, October 11, 2009 1:30 PM=

  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question for you all
  > 
  > 
  > Why do you d=
isagree that PK is responsible for most true EVPs? 
  > What about EVPs and=
/or PK tells you this might be so?
  > 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com,=
 "April Abercrombie" <april@> wrote:
  > >
  > > I agree in that much of EV=
P is just pareidolia, or the listener hearing what he wants to hear. But I =
disagree in that PK is responsible for most true EVPs.
  > > 
  > > ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
  > > From: phenom_investigator 
  > > To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com 
  > > Sent: Saturday, October 10, 2009 7:09 AM
  > > Subjec=
t: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question for you all
  > > 
  > > 
  > > If we presume tha=
t much of what is heard is in fact the result of personal PK and not a disc=
arnate voice, we may have an answer to the question of why some sourcse com=
municate and others do not.
  > > 
  > > I would suggest that while the ope=
rator may produce the voice phenomena, that operator may indeed be influenc=
ed by external agents. This could include discarnate agents. 
  > > 
  > > =
When you carefully consider what is being heard, the themes often seem to r=
eflect what may be subconscious concerns of the operator or the listener. I=
f external sources additionally inform this process of perception, it is qu=
ite possible they influence both what is recorded and how is later perceive=
d. This would also nicely explain why some people hear the same things on a=
 recording while others hear quite different things and more importantly wh=
ile one person hears different things from the same recording at different =
times.
  > > 
  > > It would also remove the requirement that discarnates m=
anifest the phenomena. If discarnates are indeed non-physical, it is unclea=
r how they would modify the physical world. On the other hand, we have good=
 evidence demonstrating the ability of living individuals to alter their en=
vironments in profound ways, apparently with their minds. So it seems to ma=
ke more sense that this might indeed by the underlying mechanism to EVPs ra=
ther than discarnate manipulations.
  > > 
  > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com, "mrscaptainjack2" <jjkamp@> wrote:
  > > >I'm wondering if a haunting=
-type situation such as yours would be different from talking to your ances=
tors four or five generations back? I guess I'm just wondering out loud wha=
t makes us connect with some entities, no matter how obscure or nonexistent=
 the connection, and not others? What makes some "tune in" to talk to us, o=
r hang around on a plane closest to us...or what? At least in a haunting, y=
ou'd be getting the entity that happened to reside at that location.
  > > =
> 
  > > > Never mind me, guys. I just have this driving need to understand=
 how all this works, and I don't think it's possible.
  > > > 
  > > > Jill=

  > > > 
  > > > 
  > > > 
  > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "purple=
spacefriend" <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
  > > > >
  > > > > 
  > > > > Caper=
icus. Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543) 
  > > > > 
  > > > > 
  > > > > F-S
=
  > > > > 
  > > > > 
  > > > > 
  > > > > 
  > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com, "mrscaptainjack2" <jjkamp@> wrote:
  > > > > >
  > > > > > Those=
 of you who have contacted entities claiming to be dead people, what is the=
 oldest person you've spoken to (in terms of how long ago they died)?
  > >=
 > > > 
  > > > > > I'm wondering because my great uncle has been coming th=
rough a lot, and he was murdered in 1942. Since I wasn't born until decades=
 later, I never knew him, but I do understand that people come through we d=
id not know in life. Has anyone else contacted someone claiming to have liv=
ed that far back? Or in another lifetime entirely?
  > > > > >
  > > > >
  =
> > >
  > >
  >
